content:
Diagnosis:
Locally advanced pancreatic acinar cell carcinoma with liver metastases

Staging:
T4N0M1, diagnosed March 2024
MSI-high, TMB 35 mut/Mb

Treatment History:
Cycle 1-2 FOLFIRINOX March-April 2024
Transitioned to pembrolizumab monotherapy May 2024 due to Grade 3 peripheral neuropathy

Current Status:
Partial response to immunotherapy
CT 15 June 2024 shows 30% reduction in pancreatic mass (6.8cm to 4.7cm) and 40% reduction in liver metastases

Current Symptoms:
Fatigue improved (grade 1)
Appetite returning with 2kg weight gain
Neuropathy improving (grade 1)
New grade 2 pruritic rash

Examination:
PS 1
Vitals stable
Rash affecting trunk and limbs (~20% BSA)
Abdomen soft, mild epigastric tenderness

Blood Results:
LFTs improving - ALT 45 (prev 120), ALP 150 (prev 280)
CA19-9 trending down from 1200 to 450

Assessment and Plan:
Good partial response to pembrolizumab with improving symptoms. Managing immune-related rash with topical steroids. Continue pembrolizumab with next cycle due 28 June. Arrange CT reassessment after cycle 4. Review in 3 weeks with blood tests.

cancer_timeline.value: Switched from FOLFIRINOX to pembrolizumab monotherapy due to Grade 3 peripheral neuropathy
CT shows 30% reduction in pancreatic mass (6.8cm to 4.7cm) and 40% reduction in liver metastases

patient_facts.value: Grade 2 pruritic rash affecting trunk and limbs (~20% BSA)

status_updates.value: Metastatic pancreatic acinar cell carcinoma showing good partial response to pembrolizumab after switching from FOLFIRINOX due to toxicity
Partial response with 30% reduction in pancreatic mass and 40% reduction in liver metastases
Grade 2 immune-related rash requiring topical steroids
Continuing pembrolizumab with next cycle due 28 June
Review in 3 weeks with blood tests
